taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek epi , upon, and phyllon , a leaf, referring to flowers borne on leaves, actually phylloclades, leaflike stems]

bio:treatment.discussion: The spineless, leaflike stems of this epiphytic genus make it easy to overlook as a member of Cactaceae. The usually white, nocturnal flowers with long, thin flower tubes, copious nectar, and strong fragrance suggest hawkmoth pollinators for most species.
